content:
Mine Dogucu
  • Home
  • Teaching
  • Research
  • Service
  • Personal

Teaching has been my passion since my childhood. Thus my friends always joke that I am the only one living her childhood dream because the rest wanted to be astronauts. Prior to teaching in higher ed, I taught mathematics at high school and middle school levels. I then started my master’s degree to learn more about teaching and learning. During my master’s, I mostly focused on statistics education and curriculum development. I researched on Bayesian education for my master’s thesis.

As a teacher of statistics and data science I use multiple strategies that are embedded in different pedagogies which I have developed over the years and continue to develop. Although I use different components of different pedagogies, my teaching is heavily rooted in constructivism. The learner is the center of the learning process. I moderate this process with modern tools.

At UCI we have a quarter system. In Fall 2019, I am teaching two sections of Stats 67 which is my first course at UCI. You can find the source code for the course website on my GitHub

For Fall 2019, I am holding teaching office hours (Thu 1:00 - 2:00 pm) for graduate students in our department. Any graduate student can stop by with any questions related to teaching such as cour

Below are the list of courses that I have taught in the semester system before joining UCI.


Spring Fall
2019 Applied Statistics (Undergraduate) - Denison University
2018 Statistical Inference II (Graduate) - New College of Florida Introduction to Data Analytics (Undergraduate) - Denison University
Dealing with Data (Undergraduate) - New College of Florida
Advanced Statistical Modeling (Undergraduate) - New College of Florida
2017 Learner Centered Classroom Assessment (Undergraduate) - The Ohio State University Applied Bayesian Analysis (Graduate) - New College of Florida
Dealing with Data II (Undergraduate) - New College of Florida
R (Undergraduate - Tutorial) - New College of Florida
Advanced R (Undergraduate - Tutorial) - New College of Florida
Making Websites Using R Markdown (January -Independent Study) - New College of Florida
2016 Learner Centered Classroom Assessment (Undergraduate) - The Ohio State University Learner Centered Classroom Assessment (Undergraduate) - The Ohio State University
Applied Multilevel Data Analysis (Graduate-TA) - The Ohio State University
2015 Introduction to Educational Statistics (Graduate - Lab TA) - The Ohio State University Learner Centered Classroom Assessment (Undergraduate) - The Ohio State University
2104 Introduction to Educational Statistics (Graduate - Lab TA) - The Ohio State University

In addition to teaching these courses, I also teach workshops and trainings mainly about using R and pedagogical training. Some of the workshops I taught include:
  • Data Visualization with ggplot2. R-Ladies Sarasota. Sarasota, FL. March, 2018.
  • Introduction to R, Workshop on R, Ohio State University Research Methodology Center, November 2015, February 2016, October 2016, February 2017, March 2017, July 2017
  • Fair and Efficient Grading. Teaching Orientation at the Ohio State University, August 2015, August 2016.
  • Introduction to SAS. Workshop on SAS, Ohio State University Crane Center for Early Childhood Research and Policy, February 2015.
  • Computer Science for High School (CS4HS) @ Bogazici. Workshop on Scratch taught to pre-service STEM teachers, Bogazici University, May 2012, May 2013.
